jobs.title: DACH Business Development Representative
jobs.description:
Business Development Manager, DACH
Must speak fluent German
FinTech / Payments                                           
Competitive Salary + OTE                                            
London

We're currently working with a really exciting Payments start up in London, who have quickly grown to around 30 people in a short space of time. They have a unique proposition which is helping to reduce the headache of payments for clients across Europe. 

Having established a great market in the UK, they are turning their attentions to Europe and in particular, the German Market. In the last year, they've had to turn away around 80% of their sales enquiries due to the fact they haven't been set up to work with European clients. This is about to change, and therefore they need a strong German Speaking sales person to come on and help drive sales via the inbound leads they are receiving.  

Role 

This is an excellent opportunity for someone with 1-2 years experience in Business Development/Sales, who is keen to move into a full 360 sales role. It's 99% inbound, which is very rare in a sales role. 

You will be qualifying and speaking to companies who are enquiring about using their payment platform for their own business.  

You will: 

•	Be central to their launch and commercial growth across Europe 
•	Move prospects through the sales pipeline and get them across the line 
•	Consult with clients to identify needs and feed back to the company 
•	Build strong business cases and coach key internal stakeholders within our prospects’ businesses 
•	Help clients progress through early onboarding before handing over to their dedicated Account Management team 
•	Design and execute targeted campaigns around key pain points or market opportunities 

About You  

•	Startup experience useful, entrepreneurial mindset vital 
•	Fluent in German 
•	Ability to interact with all departments and quickly gain an understanding of all aspects of the business 
•	At least 1 years Sales Experience  

Benefits 
•	Ample opportunity for career progression as they continue to grow and support you 
•	Annual £1000 training fund to expand your skill-set and apply what you’ve learnt in your work 
•	25 days holiday 
•	Regular team events ranging from post-work drinks to axe throwing!

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager- London
jobs.description:
Digital Marketing Manager
Email Marketing
£45,000
London

Company 

We are recruiting a Digital Marketing Executive for an exciting and fast growing email marketing company who are passionate about revolutionising the way marketers make email campaigns. Their platform is used by some of the world’s most recognisable brands and agencies to make better emails and streamline email workflow. Their platform helps marketers build on-brand email campaigns from intelligent templates using a world-class email editor, and then export to their sending platform of choice. 


Role 

They are looking for someone who can build effective multi-channel digital marketing campaigns to generate new leads and engage existing ones. 

You will have the full support of the business in this mission critical role and will enjoy the autonomy that goes with being a respected expert in your discipline. In other words, this is a ‘plan’ and then ‘do’ role that will grow as they do. 

What you will do: 

•	The development and delivery of video content, webinars, social media, online content and email to attract and accelerate leads through the entire sales funnel. 
•	Own the development and implementation of their high quality, SEO friendly content marketing. 
•	Use and own Hubspot to automate digital marketing funnels that deliver results. 
•	Optimise reach through paid, earned and partnership marketing. 
•	Manage and lead the email marketing strategy to increase interest through the whole sales funnel. 
•	Create and organise events that grow their community of fans. 
•	Manage the website to ensure it reflects our brand while attracting new leads. 
•	Report on activity and results and proactively seek out new ways to improve them. 


About you 

•	3+ years experience 
•	Detailed understanding of Hubspot, Google Analytics, Adwords, Google Keyword Planner. 
•	Experience of creating a marketing plan for new product launches, ideally for innovative/disruptive products that create their own category. 
•	Proactive about learning new techniques and analysing the email industry. 
•	Excellent self organisation, time management and project management skills. 

If you have experience in these, that’s a bonus: 

•	Organising events 
•	HTML for email or web 
•	Manipulating images and creating digital assets in Photoshop or similar 
•	Creating and editing video content

jobs.title: Helpdesk Support (3rd Line)- LAMP Stack Vital
jobs.description:
Helpdesk Support
FinTech 
£25,000-£35,000
Central London
Company 

Our client has recently raised £19 million in their recent Series A funding round. They are a leading e-money payment solutions provider operating in the UK, Europe, and Australia and with ambitious growth and international expansion plans. 

They provide a broad range of payment solutions for some of the world’s most respected companies. From providing a white labelled travel or general spend prepaid card for consumer focused brands to a range of business payment solutions offering convenience and control, they develop the right solution for a wide range of businesses. 

Role 

They are looking for someone to be the main support to their proprietary application “Eccount Platform”. You will be the bridge between the technology team and the rest of the business. There is a real career progression opportunity here to move into other areas of the business! 

•	Provide Technical Support to users of our Applications (internal staff and external clients) 
•	Investigate, analyse and diagnose technical problems 
•	Create ad-hoc reports using SQL queries 
•	Review logs 
•	Perform basic Sys Admin tasks 
•	Create and maintain Internal documentation 
•	Minor bug fixes / dev tasks 

About You 

Experience with:  

•	Linux
•	Apache HTTP Server 
•	MySQL 
•	PHP 

If you have experience in these, that’s a bonus: 

•	You have previous experience in the finance industry 
•	jQuery

jobs.title: Partner Marketing Manager- RegTech
jobs.description:
Partner Marketing Manager
High Growth RegTech - SaaS into Banking & FS. 
£Flexible Package
London
Company 

We are currently working with a great RegTech scale up in the UK who launched back in 2011. They've since grown to 70+ people across the globe, and are due to go through a big growth spurt soon. They've built groundbreaking technology that harnesses AI & Machine Learning to help Financial Institutions stay on top of, and automate their regulatory day to day work and requirements. What was once very manual, time consuming work, is now simplified massively by their tech. 

Due to the growth they are embarking on they are now looking to hire a Partner Marketing Manager in their London office.  


Role 

Over the coming years the aim for the business is that 50% of their revenues originate from their Partners, so they need to ensure they have a watertight Partner strategy in place. Typical partners for them include large corporates and consulting firms (Think Top 4 Consulting Firms, IT Outsourcers etc) as well as smaller, niche consultancies in the AML and Financial space.  

The Partner Marketing Manager will be instrumental in helping to build out partner marketing campaigns with these partners, from conception to execution.  

You'll be involved in things like:

•	Partner Enablement 
•	FAQ's 
•	Battlecards 
•	Training / Education of partners  
•	Partner Marketing Plans 
•	Campaign Planning & Execution 
•	Content Creation 
•	Events 
•	ROI Tracking 

This will be a role that will involve you working closely with just a handful of very large, corporate partners that will ultimately be driving revenue to the business via their own networks, and your role will be to make sure they have all the tools they need to do that, but also to make sure the campaign execution is there to do so.  

These are smart, integrated campaigns, rather than one-off events or stand alone campaigns- so finding someone with exposure to dealing with integrated campaigns utilising as many different tools and channels would be vital here. 

About you 

•	You will have solid exposure in a similar Partner Marketing or Alliance type of role 
•	Partners you've worked with will be large corporates or Enterprises 
•	FinTech or RegTech exposure would be ideal

jobs.title: Product Marketing Director- RegTech / FinTech SaaS
jobs.description:
Head of Product Marketing
High Growth FinTech (Series B)
£Flexible + Shares
London
Company 

We are currently working with an incredible Series-B scale-up who are doubling in size after raising $30m in their latest funding round. They are listed in the FinTech 50 and their ultimate goal is to rid the world of financial crime so people can better live their lives free from fraud. Their platform helps financial institutions to prevent and detect financial crime in a much more accurate and efficient way, thanks to their AI-based platform. In 5 years they’ve grown from founder to 190+ employees across 4 countries. As part of their growth they are now looking for a Head of Product Marketing to join their fast growing team. 

Role 

This is an exciting opportunity for someone to head up the product marketing strategy for a fast growing FinTech company. Requirements include: 

•	Own and plan global product marketing campaigns 
•	Produce outstanding content that communicates the value proposition of our products 
•	Inspire, equip and train our sales team to engage and win new customers with sales tools that support the selling process 
•	Expert knowledge on our competition and how we can consistently win against them 
•	Expert knowledge on our buyers across target segments 
•	Project management, budgeting, testing and reporting on product marketing campaigns 

About you 

•	You will have 3+ years experience in Product Marketing (ideally in B2B/SaaS/Technology) 
•	Ideally experience in a FinTech/RegTech startup 
•	Previous exposure to Product teams is essential 

Benefits 

•	Share options scheme 
•	25 days holiday 
•	Flexible working hours 
•	Company pension scheme 
•	Company health care plan 
•	Season ticket loan 
•	Cycle to work scheme 
•	Childcare vouchers

jobs.title: Senior Software Sales - Capital Markets
jobs.description:
The Company

We are working with an exciting Series A FinTech aiming to open up the global securities lending market to individual investors. Their innovative platform enables investors to lend their stocks, bonds and ETFs and generate additional returns on them. 

Their tech is revolutionising one of the last bastions of old tech within capital markets, providing investors with the ability to generate a practically risk free return without the legacy issues current incumbents have to deal with.

The Role

We are looking for someone to come in and lead the enterprise sales function of the business and you will do this by: 
•	Broadening client base across Europe, focusing on asset managers, private banks and custodians 
•	Working closely with Product, Customer Success and Operations teams to support product enhancements and identify new business opportunities 

Requirements

•	MUST have experience selling financial solutions to Capital Markets 
•	MUST have managed entire sales cycle 
•	MUST have exposure to enterprise sales (6+ months cycle)

jobs.title: Social Media Executive
jobs.description:
Social Media Executive
Series B FinTech 
Upto £30,000 +Share Options
London 

Company 

We are currently working with one of the UK’s fastest-growing FinTech's. Since 2014 they
have become one of the leading compliance and regulatory technology firms. They have
recently gone through their Series B funding round, raising $30 million they are now on a
mission to double their headcount to 300 employees in the next 18 months. They are
leveraging game-changing tech to help them on their mission, building their platform around AI, Machine Learning and Big Data, meaning that their platform is unrivalled in its capabilities.

Role 

As part of their growth, they are looking for a Social Media & Content Executive.  

Not only will this person own social media management for the business, they’ll be responsible
for all short-form copy created within the team too. They are looking for someone witty, engaging and fun who can work well with creating snippets of content that catch the eye.

Typical Responsibilities include: 

•	Short-form content creation and content planning for social media, creating assets with a designer and writing fantastic short-form copy. 
•	Responsible for managing the company social media calendar and accounts, including LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and any other relevant platforms. 
•	Plan and create content to effectively deliver the companies message globally, primarily industry-focused - e.g. Banking, Insurance, Gaming 
•	Work with all other areas of marketing to understand and effectively support their in-country campaigns and activity with appropriate content. 
•	They will also be responsible for reporting activity and performance against the campaigns you run and the copy you post, to ensure we are performing as we should be in the future. 


About you 

•	Degree in Marketing, Business, Advertising, Public Relations, Journalism or other equivalent work experience ideal. 
•	 1 years experience with B2B multi-channel content creation 
•	Experience managing social media accounts for your company (Including LinkedIn, Twitter, etc) 
•	A B2B technology marketing background - with the ability to imagine the possibilities for customers using new technology. 
•	Exposure to short-form copy creation. 
•	Witty, engaging, fun personality with a sense of humour.
